data.title: Great food!!
data.text: I had a great first experience with Chine Hut in a delivery dish! The food was really great , fast delivery and good prices! I recommend!

data.title: Quick affordable takeout
data.text:
This is a reliable, affordable, and quick option for Chinese takeout.  They have coupons which is also nice. 

The sesame chicken was by far the best entree we ordered.  It was excellently done.

The beef with broccoli wasn't done how I normally prefer for it to be done at other restaurants (I'd have liked for the beef to be cooked a little longer and I was surprised to find carrots in the dish).  I'd skip that dish next time.

data.title: Still good.
data.text: We started with egg rolls which were hot and not overly greasy. The General Tso's  Chicken, was perfectly fried and with delicious sauce.  The Pork in Garlic Sauce was actually quite spicy this time.  It was fine for me since I enjoy spicy foods but was a little too spicy for some of the other diners. The House Fried Rice was as good as ever with shrimp, chicken and pork mixed with rice, carrots, onions and peas.  Once again, a good meal and worth the trip.

data.title: Some of the best Chinese food
data.text: It seems as though there are Chinese restaurants all over South Florida, many being mediocre at best.  Then there's our local carryout, China Hut.  Without a doubt, they have the best house fried rice, General Tso's Chicken, and egg rolls in the area, and we have tried quite a few places.   The pork in garlic sauce is another one of our favorites.  The only negative about the place is that it is only pick up and delivery (NO eat in).  If you are in the area, and like General Tso's or fried rice, it's definitely worth a stop..... or a little drive.

data.title: Take out
data.text: It has that smoky scent/flavour to the food which reminds me of the Chinese restaurants in New York.  But not as fast as New York (:)  Try to order at least 15 minutes before you need it.  Their number is in my cell phone :) Dishes are tasty.

data.title: I'd just say it was ok
data.text: Ordered for delivery. Won ton soup was ick... too much dough. The garlic chicken was ok and so was the general toas. The lo mein was not to my liking i wouldn't order it again didn't find there was enough flavour. Also took over an hour for delivery.

data.title: Great takeout
data.text: This is a staple in Wellington and hands down the best Chinese food in south Florida. I'm from NY and I would say the food is definitely comparable. Have been coming here for 10 years and never disappointed  . We love the spare ribs, General Taos chicken, Lo Mein, sweet and sour chicken, garlic chicken, dumplings, cold sesame noodles.  It's all great!!

data.title: Good Chinese Food at good prices...delivered
data.text: The food is consisitently good, but the hot dishes (Sechuan, etc.  is not that spicey...so if you like spicey food, ask for extra hot.
